GlobalGoodsType.title: Software
GlobalGoodsType.description: A free and open-source software tool designed to manage, analyze, or transmit health-related data, with proven utility in multiple settings.

Interoperability.name: Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources
Interoperability.description: A standard describing data formats and elements and an application programming interface for exchanging electronic health records

ProductOverview.Summary: OpenSRP is an open source mobile health platform that allows frontline health workers to electronically register and track the health of their entire client population.
ProductOverview.Description: OpenSRP 2 is an open-source FHIR-native platform designed to support health systems delivering services and collecting data offline in communities and facilities.
ProductOverview.PrimaryFunctionality: Under the DIPC project, Ona developed the Global Goods Product Suite for Immunization is a collection of open-source digital health tools and frameworks designed to strengthen immunization programs, particularly in low- and middle-income countries. Built to be interoperable using HL7 FHIR standards, it showcases how WHO’s SMART Guidelines can be applied to create adaptable, standards-aligned solutions. Core components include OpenSRP2’s Electronic Immunization Register for tracking vaccination records and supporting health workers, DHIS2 for coverage monitoring and analytics, RapidPro for caregiver SMS reminders, and OpenHIM for secure, standards-based data exchange. The suite also supports interoperability with systems such as a Master Patient Index for accurate patient identification, vaccine supply chain management for logistics integration, and a Shared Health Record for continuity of care.
ProductOverview.Users: The primary end users are community health workers and health facility staff, typically nurse midwives, doctors, or medical officers.

Reach.SummaryOfReach: OpenSRP is used around the world by ministries of health, implementing partners, and technical partners. This includes national scale adoption, as in Tanzania.  The platform has been used in 14 country implementations (including 4 national systems) and has over 150 million patients registered as of June 2023.

Maturity.SummaryOfMaturity: All maturity model assessments are self-reported by the funded organization leading the development of the global good.  The scores for Inclusive Design, Climate Resilience and Low Carbon are not available as this assessment was done using the previous version of the maturity model.

Community.DescriptionOfCommunity: There are around 400 members of our online community. This includes around 150 very active participants from organizations that maintain, deploy, and build platforms based on OpenSRP. The community is made up of implementing partners, technical implementers, software engineers, project managers, and others working on projects and software related to OpenSRP from countries including Kenya, Tanzania, Bangladesh, Malawi, Indonesia, Zambia, Pakistan, United States of America.   The community uses a Slack group for day-to-day communication, a number of public github repos to track development progress, and its scheduled bi-monthly calls to convene.

Sustainability.Description: Ona systems is the technical steward of the platform. We have a governance group consisting of local tech and implementing partners. We have a strong core of technical partners that contribute to the development and support of the platform. OpenSRP is supported through grant and implementation funding.

collectionInitiative.label: Digital Public Goods Alliance
collectionInitiative.description: A multi-stakeholder initiative to accelerate the attainment of the Sustainable Development Goals in low- and middle-income countries by facilitating the discovery, development, use of, and investment in digital public goods.

collectionInitiative.label: DIAL Exchange
collectionInitiative.description: A platform by the Digital Impact Alliance to connect digital public goods and solutions for global development.
